byline.original: By MIREYA NAVARRO and CHARLES V. BAGLI

lead_paragraph: Developers predict projects could be choked off by the rivalry between the mayor and governor, who has outlined a bigger state role in affordable housing.

headline.print_headline: Cuomo-de Blasio Feud Threatens City’s Plans for Affordable Housing
headline.main: Cuomo-de Blasio Feud Threatens New York City’s Plans for Affordable Housing

snippet: Developers predict projects could be choked off by the rivalry between the mayor and governor, who has outlined a bigger state role in affordable housing.
abstract: Developers and bankers in New York State are concerned that unrelenting feud between Gov Andrew M Cuomo and New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio over many issues will threaten financing of affordable housing in city; Cuomo administration has said city will lose large share of up to $900 million state provides to city in federal tax-exempt bonds for affordable housing projects in all five boroughs.
